question.text: During protein synthesis which of the following is TRUE?

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>  is required for completion of ribosome
23s rRNA in bacteria is the enzyme ribozyme that act as catalyst for the formation of peptide bond.
EF - Ts helps on codon- anticodon recognition.

solution.text: The biosynthesis of protein inside a living cell is called translation. This process occurs in the cytoplasm where the ribosome is present. Bacteria have a 70s ribosome that is made up of smaller subunit i.e.30s and bigger subunit i.e.50s.30s subunit has 16s rRNA (ribonucleic acid) and 50s subunit has 23s rRNA and 5s rRNA in which 23sRNA has peptidyl transferase activity that catalyzes the formation of the peptide bond.
